arm_group.arm_group_label: Household water filter and improved cook stove
arm_group.description: Vestergaard-Frandsen LifeStraw Family 2.0 filter and Ecozoom stove
Traditional water management practices and cooking stoves

brief_summary.textblock:
DelAgua Health and Development, Manna Energy and the Rwanda Ministry of Health are
      collaborating on a project financed by carbon credits that will distribute household-based
      water filters and high-efficiency cook stoves to approximately 600,000 households in Rwanda.
      Prior to the full roll out of the campaign, the implementers are conducting research in
      connection with a distribution among 2000 households in western Rwanda. The objective of
      this matched cohort study (Phase 1B)are to investigate whether the filters and stoves
      delivered in October 2012 are still performing and in use, to determine whether they are
      associated with reductions in exposure to pathogens from drinking water and stoves, and to
      assembly information on health and other conditions necessary for the design of a large
      scale health impact evaluation.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of a Project to Distribute Water Filters and Cook Stoves in Western Rwanda--Phase 1B
clinical_study.condition: Focus of Study is to Assess Filter/Stove Use and Efficacy in Reducing Exposure to Waterborne and Airborne Pathogens.

criteria.textblock:
Households will be eligible to participate in the study if they reside in selected
        villages and are willing to participate after receiving complete details regarding the
        study.  Intervention households must have a functioning stove and water filter in order to
        participate, though they do not need to be in regular use.  We will enroll all households
        with a child under 5 years of age if they are in Ubudehe groups 1 or 2.

study_pop.textblock:
Lower income (ubudehe groups 1 and 2) householders from 18 villages (9 intervention and
        matched controls) in 11 designated Districts in Rwanda: Rutsiro, Karongi, Ngororero,
        Nyamasheke, Nyabihu Districts of Western Province (excluding part of the district to the
        north of the Ruhengeri road); Rubuvu District (excluding part of the district to the north
        of the Ruhengeri road); Nyaruguru, Nyamagabe, Muhanga, and Ruhango Districts in Southern
        Province; Gakenke District in Northern Province.

clinical_study.keyword: Focus of study is to assess filter/stove use and efficacy in reducing exposure to waterborne and airborne pathogens.
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing the Impact of Water Filters and Improved Cook Stoves on Drinking Water and Quality and Indoor Air Pollution: A Matched Cohort Study in Rwanda

other_outcome.description: PM2.5 and CO concentrations during the 48 hour sampling period
other_outcome.measure: Exposure to PM2.5 and CO in primary cooking areas (mg/m3)

overall_official.affiliation: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine

authority: United Kingdom: LSHTM Research Ethics Committee (Approval #6457)
Rwanda: National Ethics Committee, Ministry of Health

primary_outcome.description: PM2.5 and CO concentrations will be measure in mg/m3 and reported as the mean concentration over 48 hours.
primary_outcome.measure: Personal exposure to PM2.5 and CO (mg/m3)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine
responsible_party.investigator_title: Reader in Water, Sanitation and Health

secondary_outcome.description: TTC will be measured as the total number of colony forming units (CFU) of TTC in the water sample and will be reported as number of CFU per 100ml of sample water.
secondary_outcome.measure: Thermotolerant coliforms (TTC) in colony forming units (CFU) per 100ml of sample water

clinical_study.source: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine

lead_sponsor.agency: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
